de.esoco.process.step

Class InteractionFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • org.obrel.core.SerializableRelatedObject
        • de.esoco.process.ProcessElement
          • de.esoco.process.ProcessFragment
            • de.esoco.process.step.InteractionFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.manage.Initializable, java.io.Serializable, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractEntityListItem, ChooseEntity, DisplayEntityHistory, DisplayEntityHistory.HistoryData, DisplayEntityHistory.HistoryOptions, DisplayUrl, EditEntity, EditEntityTags, EditInteractionParameters, EditInteractionParameters.EditInteractionParameter, EditText, EntityList, EntityListHeader, FilterEntityTags, LoginFragment, MessageBoxFragment.MessageBoxContent, ProcessControlFragment, SelectEntities, SelectEntity, SelectValues, SettingsFragment, SubProcessFragment, UiContainer.UiContainerFragment, UiRootFragment, ViewFragment

    public abstract class InteractionFragment
extends ProcessFragment
implements de.esoco.lib.manage.Initializable
    A process element subclass that serves as a fragment of an interactive process step. This allows to split the user interface of complex interactions into different parts that can more easily be re-used.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void abort()
      This method will be invoked if the current execution of this fragment is aborted before it has finished. and can be overridden by subclasses to perform data resets similar to the rollback() method which will be invoked if the execution of a finished fragment is to be reverted.
      void abortFragment()
      Internal method to abort the current execution of this fragment.

      • abortFragment

        public final void abortFragment()
        Internal method to abort the current execution of this fragment. It can be used to undo data and parameter initializations or interactive modifications that have been performed by this fragment. Subclasses must implement abort() instead.

      • addDisplayParameters

        public void addDisplayParameters(java.util.Collection<? extends org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> rParams)
        Overridden to add nonexistent parameters to the list of interaction parameters of this instance as returned by the method getInteractionParameters(). The returned collection must therefore be mutable (as is the case with the default parameter collection).

        This implementation replaces the base class implementation which changes the interaction parameters of the process step instead of the fragment.

        Overrides:
        addDisplayParameters in class ProcessElement
        Parameters:
        rParams - The interaction parameters to add

        public void addInputParameters(java.util.Collection<? extends org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> rParams)

      • addSubFragment

        public ParameterList addSubFragment(int nIndex,
                                    InteractionFragment rSubFragment)
        Convenience method for the common case where the same sub-fragment type needs to be added multiple times to this parent fragment. The name of the fragment will be created from the fragment class and the given index (which must be different for each new instance). The fragment class name will also be set as the resource ID.
        Parameters:
        nIndex - The fragment index
        rSubFragment - The fragment to add
        Returns:
        The wrapper for the fragment parameter
        See Also:
        addSubFragment(String, InteractionFragment)

      • addSubFragment

        public ParameterList addSubFragment(java.lang.String sName,
                                    InteractionFragment rSubFragment)
        Adds a subordinate fragment to this instance into a temporary parameter and optionally displays it. The temporary parameter relation type will be created with the given name by invoking listParam(String, Class) and the parameter wrapper will be returned. The fragment will be added by invoking addSubFragment(RelationType, InteractionFragment). Furthermore the UI property StyleProperties.HIDE_LABEL will be set on the new fragment parameter because fragments are typically displayed without a label.
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the temporary fragment parameter
        rSubFragment - The fragment to add
        Returns:
        The wrapper for the fragment parameter

      • lockEntityForProcess

        public boolean lockEntityForProcess(Entity rEntity,
                                    java.lang.String sLockUnavailableMessage)
        Tries to lock an entity during the remaining execution of the current process and displays an information message if the entity is already locked by some other context. The lock will automatically be removed if the process is terminated in any way but. The lock can also be removed explicitly by calling Process.unlockEntity(Entity). Because the lock is process-wide this method should also be invoked in implementations of abort() and rollback() to handle process rollbacks.
        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to lock
        sLockUnavailableMessage - The message to display if the lock couldn't be acquired
        Returns:
        TRUE if the lock could be acquired

      • lockEntityForStep

        public boolean lockEntityForStep(Entity rEntity,
                                 java.lang.String sLockUnavailableMessage)
        Tries to lock an entity during the execution of the current step and displays an information message if the entity is already locked by some other context. The lock will automatically be removed if the process progresses to another step (including rollback) or is terminated in any way. The lock can also be removed explicitly by calling ProcessFragment.unlockEntity(Entity).
        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to lock
        sLockUnavailableMessage - The message to display if the lock couldn't be acquired
        Returns:
        TRUE if the lock could be acquired

      • markFragmentInputParams

        public void markFragmentInputParams()

      • notifyParameterUpdateListeners

        public void notifyParameterUpdateListeners()
        Notifies all listeners for parameter updates that are registered in the relation ProcessRelationTypes.PARAM_UPDATE_LISTENERS of this fragment's process step. Because relations are shared between fragments this will affect all fragments in the current interaction.

      • panel

        public ParameterList panel(java.lang.String sName,
                           de.esoco.lib.property.LayoutType ePanelLayout,
                           de.esoco.lib.expression.function.Initializer<InteractionFragment> rInitializer)
        Creates a new anonymous interaction fragment and the associated parameter relation type. The initializer argument must perform the initialization of the new fragment which it receives as the argument to it's Initializer.init(Object) method.

        This method is mainly intended to be used with lambda expressions introduced with Java 8. In that case it allows concise in-line declarations of panels by simply forwarding the initialization to a corresponding method in form of a method reference with an InteractionFragment parameter.

        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the fragment parameter
        ePanelLayout - The layout of the panel fragment
        rInitializer - The fragment initializer
        Returns:
        A new parameter wrapper for the panel parameter

        public void prepareInteraction()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Can be implemented by subclasses to initialize the interaction of this fragment. This method will be invoked on every iteration of this fragment's interaction, i.e. on the first run and every time after an interaction event occurred. The default implementation does nothing.

      • removeInteractionParameters

        public void removeInteractionParameters(java.util.Collection<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> rParams)
        Removes parameters from the lists returned by the methods getInteractionParameters() and getInputParameters(). These lists must therefore be mutable!

        This implementation replaces the base class implementation because the parent method changes the interaction parameters of the process step.

        Overrides:
        removeInteractionParameters in class ProcessElement
        Parameters:
        rParams - The parameters to remove

      • showDialog

        public DialogFragment showDialog(java.lang.String sParamNameTemplate,
                                 InteractionFragment rContentFragment,
                                 boolean bModal,
                                 DialogFragment.DialogActionListener rDialogListener,
                                 java.util.Collection<DialogFragment.DialogAction> rDialogActions)
        Adds a sub-fragment to be displayed as a modal dialog.
        See Also:

      • showDialog

        public DialogFragment showDialog(java.lang.String sParamNameTemplate,
                                 InteractionFragment rContentFragment,
                                 boolean bModal,
                                 java.lang.String sQuestion,
                                 DialogFragment.DialogActionListener rDialogListener,
                                 java.util.Collection<DialogFragment.DialogAction> rDialogActions)
        Adds a sub-fragment to be displayed as a dialog. The parameter for the dialog fragment will be added automatically to the input parameters of this instance. Therefore the parameter lists of this instance MUST be mutable!

        If the creating code needs to programmatically close the dialog view instead of by a button click of the user it can do so by invoking the ViewFragment.hide() method on the returned view fragment instance on a corresponding interaction.

        Parameters:
        sParamNameTemplate - The name template to be used for generated dialog parameter names or NULL to derive it from the content fragment
        rContentFragment - The fragment to be displayed as the dialog content
        bModal - TRUE for a modal view
        sQuestion - A string (typically a question) that will be displayed next to the dialog action buttons.
        rDialogListener - The dialog action listener or NULL for none
        rDialogActions - The actions to be displayed as the dialog buttons
        Returns:
        The new dialog fragment instance

      • showErrorMessage

        public MessageBoxFragment showErrorMessage(java.lang.String sMessage)
        Displays a message with an error icon and a single OK button.
        See Also:
        #showMessageBox(String, String, DialogActionListener, Collection, RelationType...)

      • showInfoMessage

        public MessageBoxFragment showInfoMessage(java.lang.String sMessage)
        Displays a message with an info icon and a single OK button.
        See Also:
        #showMessageBox(String, String, DialogActionListener, Collection, RelationType...)

      • showMessageBox

        public MessageBoxFragment showMessageBox(java.lang.String sMessage,
                                         java.lang.String sIcon,
                                         DialogFragment.DialogActionListener rDialogListener,
                                         DialogFragment.DialogAction... rDialogActions)
        Displays a process message in a message box dialog. The parameter for the dialog fragment will be added automatically to the input parameters of this instance. Therefore the parameter lists of this instance MUST be mutable!
        See Also:
        #showMessageBox(String, String, DialogActionListener, Collection, RelationType...)

      • showMessageBox

        public MessageBoxFragment showMessageBox(java.lang.String sMessage,
                                         java.lang.String sIcon,
                                         DialogFragment.DialogActionListener rDialogListener,
                                         java.util.Collection<DialogFragment.DialogAction> rDialogActions,
                                         org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>... rExtraParams)
        Displays a process message in a message box dialog. The parameter for the dialog fragment will be added automatically to the input parameters of this instance. Therefore the parameter lists of this instance MUST be mutable!

        If one or more extras parameters are given they will be displayed between the message and the dialog buttons. Any necessary initialization of these parameters including UI properties must be done by the invoking code before invoking the message box.

        Parameters:
        sMessage - The message to be displayed in the message box
        sIcon - The resource name for an icon or NULL for the standard icon.
        rDialogListener - The dialog action listener or NULL for none
        rDialogActions - The actions to be displayed as the message box buttons
        rExtraParams - Optional extra parameters to be displayed in the message box
        Returns:
        The view fragment that has been created for the message box

      • showModalDialog

        public DialogFragment showModalDialog(InteractionFragment rContentFragment,
                                      java.util.Collection<DialogFragment.DialogAction> rDialogActions)
        Displays a modal dialog with a name prefix that is derived from the name of the content fragment.
        See Also:
        #showDialog(String, InteractionFragment, boolean, String, DialogActionListener, Collection)

      • showView

        public ViewFragment showView(java.lang.String sParamNameTemplate,
                             InteractionFragment rContentFragment,
                             boolean bModal)
        Adds a sub-fragment to be displayed as a view. The parameter for the view fragment will be added automatically to the input parameters of this instance. Therefore the parameter lists of this instance MUST be mutable!

        Because a view has no explicit buttons like dialogs it must be closed by the creating code by invoking the ViewFragment.hide() method on the returned view fragment instance on a corresponding interaction.

        Parameters:
        sParamNameTemplate - The name template to be used for generated view parameter names
        rContentFragment - The fragment to be displayed as the view content
        bModal - TRUE for a modal view
        Returns:
        The new view fragment to provide access to it's method ViewFragment.hide()

      • validateFragmentParameters

        public java.util.Map<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>,java.lang.String> validateFragmentParameters(boolean bOnInteraction)
        Internal method to validate the fragment's process parameters during state changes of the process. Subclasses must implement validateParameters(boolean) instead.
        Parameters:
        bOnInteraction - TRUE if the validation occurs during an ongoing interaction, FALSE after the final interaction before the fragment is finished
        Returns:
        A mapping from invalid parameters to validation error message (empty for none)

      • validateParameters

        public java.util.Map<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>,java.lang.String> validateParameters(boolean bOnInteraction)
        This method can be overridden by subclasses to validate process parameters during state changes of the process. The default implementation returns an new empty map instance that may be modified freely by overriding methods to add their own error messages if necessary.
        Parameters:
        bOnInteraction - TRUE if the validation occurs during an ongoing interaction, FALSE after the final interaction before the fragment is finished
        Returns:
        A mapping from invalid parameters to validation error message (empty for none)

      • validationError

        public void validationError(java.util.Map<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>,java.lang.String> rValidationErrors)
        Signals validation errors that occurred in this fragment. The default implementation delegates the handling to the parent fragment (if such exists). Subclasses can override this method somewhere in the hierarchy if they need to display validation errors more prominently. This will not override the default process parameter validation.
        Parameters:
        rValidationErrors - A mapping from parameters to validation error messages

      • abort

        protected void abort()
        This method will be invoked if the current execution of this fragment is aborted before it has finished. and can be overridden by subclasses to perform data resets similar to the rollback() method which will be invoked if the execution of a finished fragment is to be reverted.

      • afterInteraction

        protected void afterInteraction(org.obrel.core.RelationType<?> rInteractionParam)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Can be implemented by subclasses to react on interactions that occurred in other fragments. This method will be invoked after handleInteraction(RelationType). The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rInteractionParam - The interaction parameter
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any kind of exception may be thrown in case of errors

      • canRollback

        protected boolean canRollback()
        This method can be overridden by a subclass to indicate whether it supports a rollback of the modifications it has performed. The default implementation always returns TRUE.
        Returns:
        TRUE if the step implementation support a rollback
        See Also:
        rollback()

      • getValueDatatype

        protected <T> java.lang.Class<T> getValueDatatype(T rValue)

      • initComplete

        protected void initComplete()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This method will be invoked after the initialization of a fragment and it's hierarchy of sub-fragments has been completed. This means that when this method is invoked on a child fragment it's parent has been initialized but it's initComplete() method hasn't been invoked yet.

        The purpose of this method is for subclasses to execute code that depends on a full initialization. The default implementation does nothing.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the post-initialization code fails

      • initProcessStep

        protected void initProcessStep(Interaction rProcessStep)
        Will be invoked after the process step of this fragment has been set. Can be implemented by subclasses to initialize process step-specific parameters. The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rProcessStep - The process step of this fragment

      • prepareUpload

        protected void prepareUpload(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> rFileSelectParam,
                             UploadHandler rUploadHandler)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Prepares the upload of a file with . This requires two parameters. One string parameter that will be configured to invoke a file chooser and then holds the name of the selected file. This parameter must be configured as an input parameter. And a target parameter that will receive the result of a successful file upload.
        Parameters:
        rFileSelectParam - The parameter for the file selection
        rUploadHandler - The upload handler
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If preparing the upload fails

      • prepareUpload

        protected void prepareUpload(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> rFileSelectParam,
                             org.obrel.core.RelationType<byte[]> rTargetParam,
                             java.util.regex.Pattern rContentTypePattern,
                             int nMaxSize)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Prepares the upload of a file into a process parameter. This requires two parameters. One string parameter that will be configured to invoke a file chooser and then holds the name of the selected file. This parameter must be configured as an input parameter. And a target parameter that will receive the result of a successful file upload.
        Parameters:
        rFileSelectParam - The parameter for the file selection
        rTargetParam - The target parameter for the file content
        rContentTypePattern - A pattern that limits allowed content types or NULL for no restriction
        nMaxSize - The maximum upload size
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If preparing the upload fails
        See Also:
        prepareUpload(RelationType, UploadHandler)

      • rollback

        protected void rollback()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Can be overridden to perform a rollback of data and parameter modifications that have been performed by this fragment. By default all fragments are assumed to be capable of being rolled back. The default implementation does nothing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the rollback fails

      • setParameterValuesFromEntity

        protected void setParameterValuesFromEntity(Entity rEntity,
                                            java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> rAttributes)
                                     throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Sets the values of process parameters from the attributes of an entity. To make this work the given relation types must be entity attribute types which will then be set as process parameters. The attributes can either by direct or extra attributes (which must have the extra attribute flag set).

        To set modified parameter values back into the entity the method updateEntityFromParameterValues(Entity, List) can be invoked.

        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to read the attributes from
        rAttributes - The entity attributes and process parameters
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If querying an extra attribute fails

      • setParameterValuesFromEntity

        protected void setParameterValuesFromEntity(Entity rEntity,
                                            org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>... rParams)
                                     throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        See Also:
        setParameterValuesFromEntity(Entity, List)

      • setParent

        protected void setParent(InteractionFragment rParent)
        Sets the parent fragment of this instance.
        Parameters:
        rParent - The parent fragment

      • updateEntityFromParameterValues

        protected void updateEntityFromParameterValues(Entity rEntity,
                                               java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> rParams)
                                        throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Updates the attributes of an entity from the process parameter values that are stored with the given entity attribute relation types. The attributes can either be direct or extra attributes.

        To set the process parameters from entity attributes the reverse method setParameterValuesFromEntity(Entity, List) can be used.

        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to update
        rParams - The process parameter and entity attribute relation types
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - if setting an extra attribute fails
